Trial_Design.evidence: Patients were randomly assigned to NPWT and CWT stratified by study site and wound size using a centralized web-based tool.

Participants.evidence: The multicenter, multinational, randomized clinical SAWHI study enrolled a total of 539 consecutive, compliant adult patients with SAWHI after surgery without fascial dehiscence between August 2, 2011, and January 31, 2018.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomly assigned to NPWT and CWT stratified by study site and wound size using a centralized web-based tool.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The resource use analysis was primarily based on the per protocol population (NPWT 157; CWT 174).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Patients were randomly assigned to NPWT and CWT stratified by study site and wound size using a centralized web-based tool.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The multicenter, multinational, randomized clinical SAWHI study enrolled a total of 539 consecutive, compliant adult patients with SAWHI after surgery without fascial dehiscence between August 2, 2011, and January 31, 2018.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The resource use analysis was primarily based on the per protocol population (NPWT 157; CWT 174).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Although treatment length within 42â€Šdays was significantly shorter in the NPWT arm {Mean [Standard deviation (SD)] NPWT 22.8 (13.4); CWT 30.6 (13.3); P < 0.001 U -test}, hospitalization time was shorter with CWT [Mean (SD) NPWT 13.9 (11.1); CWT 11.8 (10.8); P = 0.047 U -test].
